Key Match Events: The Dodgers avoided chasing Kodai Senga's signature 'ghost fork,' and instead, Senga threw mostly ineffective cutters that darted outside the strike zone.

Sean Manaea will get the call against a bullpen game for the Dodgers, who have thrown 33 straight scoreless innings — matching the postseason record established by the 1966 Orioles, albeit in the World Series.
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams.
The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
The Mets could skip Senga next time, potentially letting David Peterson start a Game 5 at Citi Field.
Post-Match Reflections: Francisco Lindor said, '[But] we didn’t play the game better than they did.'
Senga said, 'I’m frustrated and disappointed but I need to keep making adjustments and the team has got a game [Monday], so we have just got to keep winning games.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the gamble in starting Senga in October without a proper buildup — following the calf strain that left him on the injured list after two months.
The Mets will need to rally from behind in a series for the first time this postseason.
Others: The Mets were non-competitive in a game for the first time this postseason.
Jack Flaherty gave the Dodgers seven shutout innings in which he allowed two hits with two walks and six strikeouts.
